# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Below is the Julia program which accomplishes this:
```julia
function wrap_string(input_str, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(input_str, ' ')
    output_str = ""
    current_length = 0
    
    for word in words
        if current_length + length(word) > text_width
            output_str *= "\n"
            current_length = 0
        end
        
        output_str *= " " * word
        current_length += length(word)
    end
    
    return strip(output_str)
end
```
You can use this function like so:
```julia
input_text = "This is a test string for wrapping"
println(wrap_string(input_text, 10))
```
The output will be:
```julia
"This is a 
test string 
for wrapping"
```
